content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a gentleman named Peter Schmidt.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price of an apartment in Duisburg.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, what was the reason for not agreeing on a price?
name: Evaluator

content: The reason for not agreeing on a price was that the landlord, Mr. Schmidt, was aiming high and was not willing to accept the price I offered, which was lower than his asking price. He was only concerned about the price, not the specifics of the lease or utilities.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: Why did you rate the likeability as a 4? What were the factors that influenced your rating?
name: Evaluator

content: I rated the likeability as a 4 because the negotiation process was quite tense. The landlord, Mr. Schmidt, was not willing to budge on the price, which made the negotiation difficult. He was focused solely on the price, which is understandable from a business perspective, but it made the negotiation process less pleasant.
name: Maryam Abbasi

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator
